intro: Acourtia souleana, commonly known as the Soulean's acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It is a perennial herb that produces small, edible fruits, though it is not widely cultivated. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
